content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find a recipe for a cauliflower pizza crust that has a preparation time of under 30 minutes and a rating of at least 4 stars on Allrecipes. Include the number of calories per serving.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to search for a cauliflower pizza crust recipe on Allrecipes. To do so, I should use the search functionality. The search textbox appears to be element [2], and the search button is [3]. My next step is to enter the search query "cauliflower pizza crust" into the textbox.
Action: Type [2]; cauliflower pizza crust
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search for "cauliflower pizza crust" has been executed, and several recipe images are displayed below the search bar. I need to inspect one of these recipes to check its preparation time, star rating, and calories per serving. I will click the first recipe result ([9]) to investigate further.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Cauliflower Pizza Crust recipe has a rating of 4.3, which meets the requirement of at least 4 stars. However, I still need to find the preparation time and calories per serving. These details are typically shown further down or alongside the recipe information. I should scroll down to locate these key facts.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The section displaying prep time, cook time, and total time is visible at the bottom of the screenshot, but the actual values are not shown. I need to scroll down further to view these specific details and check if the prep time is under 30 minutes. I should also continue looking for the calories per serving.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I see the "Jump to Nutrition Facts" button [11], which likely links directly to the nutrition information, including calories per serving. This is one of the requirements. To expedite finding the calories, I should click this button to jump quickly to the Nutrition Facts section.
Action: Click [11]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The nutrition facts section is visible. The recipe has 59 calories per serving, which is clearly shown. I already confirmed earlier that the star rating is at least 4 (4.3). I now need to return to the recipe details to confirm the "preparation time under 30 minutes" requirement. This info usually appears near the top or above the ingredients, so scrolling up might reveal the prep time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current section shows a photo of the cauliflower pizza and some interaction buttons (Save, Print, I Made It), but not the preparation or cook time information. The section with time details should be slightly above this, near the recipe title. I need to scroll up again to locate the preparation time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The section now shows additional recipe process images, but still does not display the explicit preparation or cook time information. The text in the image mentions "about 15 minutes" to tender the cauliflower, suggesting a short prep time, but I need the formal prep time value typically listed near the recipe title or info box. I need to scroll up further to find the official preparation time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current view displays more recipe steps and photos, but still does not show the official preparation time listing, which is typically located near the top of the recipe or right before the ingredient list. I need to scroll up further to reach the section that summarizes prep/cook/total times.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.93
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows step-by-step instructions (currently at step 5) and process photos, but not the recipe summary details such as prep time, cook time, or total time. These are usually higher up on the page. I need to continue scrolling up to reach the section that lists all the key recipe statistics together.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.94
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This screenshot still shows step-by-step process photos and instructions but does not reveal the summarized prep, cook, or total time details for the recipe. Those important details are typically toward the very top or above the ingredient list. I need to scroll up more to reach that section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.95
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This view still displays the step-by-step recipe instructions (currently Step 4) and process images, without revealing the summarized preparation, cook, or total time information required for the task. I need to continue scrolling up to reach the section that lists the prep time details.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.96
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot still displays process images, without revealing the summarized preparation, cook, or total time information. The prep/cook/total time details should be just above this section, likely near the recipe introduction or ingredient list. I should keep scrolling up to find the official preparation time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.97
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows additional process photos and instructions (currently at Step 2), but not the summary section with prep/cook/total time. The desired information should be even further above, likely at the very top of the recipe before the steps begin. I need to scroll up again to reach that overview section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.98
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot now shows the "Directions" section and the very last listed ingredient, but still not the recipe overview (prep time, cook time, total time) which usually appears directly above the ingredient list and before the instructions. I need to scroll slightly further up to reach the recipe summary box.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.99

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Main menu for Allrecipes";	[1]: "Allrecipes", "Visit Allrecipes' homepage";	[2]: <button> "Save", "Save Recipe";	[3]: <button> "Rate", "Rate It";	[4]: "Log In";	[6]: "Join for free: Use MyRecipes to save 100K+ recipes from Allrecipes and more";	[7]: <button> "Close";	[11]: <button> "Jump to Nutrition Facts";	[12]: <button> "Toggle Cook Mode";	[13]: "(Keep screen awake)";	[14]: "1/2x";	[16]: "1x";	[17]: "2x";	[18]: <button> "";	[19]: "½ head cauliflower, coarsely chopped";	[20]: "½ cup shredded Italian cheese blend";

content:
Thought: The screenshot now shows the beginning of the Ingredients section, the Cook Mode toggle, the "Jump to Nutrition Facts" button, and some recipe scaling options. The recipe summary with prep, cook, and total time should be just above this section. I need to scroll up just a bit more to view the prep time information.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.995

Thought: The prep time, cook time, and additional time fields are now visible in the orange info box at the bottom of the screenshot. Although the actual values are not entirely shown in this view, a small scroll down should reveal the complete times. This is the final missing requirement for evaluating if the preparation time is under 30 minutes.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.999

Thought: The screen has returned to the Ingredients section and "Jump to Nutrition Facts" button. This appears to be a repeated or misplaced screenshot, as it does not reveal the prep/cook/total time values that were nearly visible before. I need to scroll down again to bring the recipe time info fully into view.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
